sen.j: 墨染駅（すみぞめえき）は、京都府京都市伏見区深草北新町にある京阪電気鉄道京阪本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Fukakusa-kitashin-machi, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Sumizome Station is a stop on the Keihan Main Line, which is operated by Keihan Electric Railway.
Sumizone Station, located in Fukakusa-kitashin-machi, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Keihan Main Line, which is operated by Keihan Electric Railway.
Sumizome Station, located in Fukakusa-kitashin-machi, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Keihan Main Line, which is operated by Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 相対式2面2線ホームを持つ地上駅。
sen.e: It is located on the ground level, with two parallel platforms serving two tracks between them.
It is located on the ground level, with two parallel platforms serving two tracks between them.
It is located on the ground level, with two parallel platforms serving two tracks between them.

sen.j: 改札口は上下線で独立しており、改札内で互いのホームを行き来することは出来ない。
sen.e: An entrace/exit gate place is provided independently for each of the inbound and outbound trains, and you cannot move between the platforms within the entrace/exit gate places.
An entrance/exit gate is provided independently for each of the inbound and outbound trains, but one cannot move between the platforms within the entrance/exit gates.
A ticket gate is provided independently for each of the inbound and outbound trains, but one cannot move between the platforms within the ticket gates.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gate としました。

sen.j: なお、上下線とも改札口はホーム丹波橋寄りにある。
sen.e: Both of the entrace/exit gate places are located on the Tanba-bashi Bridge side of the platforms.
Both of the entrance/exit gate places are located on the Tanba-bashi Bridge side of the platforms.
Both of the ticket gates are located on the Tambabashi side of the platforms.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gate としました。丹波橋駅と解釈し、Tambabashi としました。

sen.j: 1980年代半ばより、駅名にちなんでホームの柱をグレーに塗っている。
sen.e: Since around the mid-1980s, the pillars of the platforms have been painted gray corresponding to the station name.
Since around the mid-1980s, the pillars of the platforms have been painted gray, corresponding to the name of the station.
Since around the mid-1980s, the pillars of the platforms have been painted gray, corresponding to the name of the station.

sen.j: 1990年代半ばまで構内踏切があったが、現在は撤去されている。
sen.e: Until around the mid-1990, a railraod crossing within the premises existed but has been removed.
A railroad crossing within the premises existed until around the mid-1990s, but eventually it was removed.
A railroad crossing within the premises existed until around the mid-1990s, but eventually it was removed.

sen.e: Platforms
Platforms
Platforms

sen.j: ※両ホームとも有効長は7両。
sen.e: * The lengths of both platforms are that for seven-car trains.
* Each platform has a length sufficient to accommodate a seven-car train.
* Each platform has a length sufficient to accommodate a seven-car train.

sen.j: 番線表示はない。
sen.e: No track number is displayed.
No track number is displayed.
No track number is displayed.

sen.j: JR藤森駅 - 西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）奈良線 東約600m
sen.e: JR Fujinomori Station - a station on the Nara Line of West Japan Railway Company (JR West), located in an approx. 600-m east of this station
JR Fujinomori Station, a station on the Nara Line of West Japan Railway Company (JR West), is located approximately 600 meters east of this station.
JR Fujinomori Station, a station on the Nara Line of West Japan Railway Company (JR West), is located approximately 600 meters east of this station.

sen.j: 伏見駅 (京都府) - 近鉄京都線 南西約700m
sen.e: Fushimi Station (located in Kyoto Prefecture) - a station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, located in an approx. 700-m southeast of this station
Fushimi Station (located in Kyoto Prefecture), a station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, is located approximately 700 meters southeast of this station.
Fushimi Station (Kyoto Prefecture), a station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, is located approximately 700 meters southwest of this station.

sen.j: バスのりば
sen.e: Bus stops
Bus stops
Bus stops

sen.j: 京阪墨染駅には、バス路線は乗り入れていない。
sen.e: No route bus service is available at Keihan Sumizome Station.
No route bus service is available at Keihan Sumizome Station.
No route bus service is available at Keihan Sumizome Station.

sen.j: 最寄バス停：京都市交通局墨染または下町
sen.e: The bus stop nearest to the station: the Sumizome bus stop or the Shitamach bus stop for buses of Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau
The bus stop nearest to the station: The Sumizome bus stop or the Shitamachi bus stop for buses of the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau
The bus stop nearest to the station: The Sumizome bus stop or the Shitamachi bus stop for buses of the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau

sen.j: 周辺道路の一方通行規制により、方面ごとにのりばが異なる。
sen.e: Since there are many one-way streets around the station, a bus stop site for a route bus is placed depending on in which direction the bus goes.
Because there are many one-way streets around the station, a bus stop site for a route bus is provided, depending on the bus's direction of travel.
Because there are many one-way streets around the station, a bus stop site for a route bus is provided, depending on the bus's direction of travel.

sen.e: This bus stop is reached in a 3-minute walk to the south of Sumizome Station
This bus stop is just a three-minute walk south of Sumizome Station.
This bus stop is just a three-minute walk south of Sumizome Station.

Small-size buses are used on the route throughout the day.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1910年（明治43年）4月15日 開業。
sen.e: April 15, 1910: Operation of this station started.
April 15, 1910: The station became operational.
April 15, 1910: The station became operational.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄（阪急電鉄）の駅となる。
sen.e: October 1, 1943: The companies concerned merged and this station became a station of Keihanshin-kyuko-dentetsu (Hankyu Corporation).
October 1, 1943: The companies concerned merged, and this station became a facility of Keihanshin-kyuko-dentetsu (Hankyu Corporation).
October 1, 1943: The companies concerned merged, and this station became a facility of Keihanshin Express Electric Railway (Hankyu Corporation).
sen.cmt: 京阪神急行電鉄→Keihanshin Express Electric Railway としました。

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）12月1日 会社分離により京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: December 1, 1949: Due to a separation of the company, this station became a station of Keihan Electric Railway.
December 1, 1949: Due to a separation of the company, this station became a facility of Keihan Electric Railway.
December 1, 1949: Due to a separation of the company, this station became a facility of Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 1972年（昭和47年）9月1日 下りホーム改札口を使用開始。
sen.e: September 1, 1972: Use of the entrance/exit gate place for the platform for the outbound trains started.
September 1, 1972: The use of the entrance/exit gate for the platform for outbound trains started.
September 1, 1972: The use of the ticket gate for the platform for outbound trains started.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gate としました。

sen.j: 1985年（昭和60年）3月1日 京都行きホームにトイレ新設、ホーム屋根10m延伸。
sen.e: March 1, 1985: A lavatory was newly installed on the platform for the trains for Kyoto, and the roofs of the platforms were extended by 10 m.
March 1, 1985: A lavatory was installed on the platform for the trains bound for Kyoto, and the roofs of the platforms were extended by ten meters.
March 1, 1985: A lavatory was installed on the platform for the trains bound for Kyoto, and the roofs of the platforms were extended by ten meters.

sen.j: 1995年（平成7年）10月3日 新駅舎使用開始
sen.e: 1995: Use of the new station house started.
1995: The new station house came into use.
October 3, 1995: The new station house came into use.
